results.title: Academy Museum Gives Debbie Reynolds Her Due as a Costume Conservator
results.abstract: When the “Singin’ in the Rain” actress was alive, the film academy turned up its nose at her fabled costume collection. Now it has gone to her son with hat in hand.

multimedia.caption: “My mother was one of the most forgiving people ever,” said Todd Fisher, Debbie Reynolds’s son, who inherited the remaining part of her collection. “She would never want me to hold a grudge.”
multimedia.copyright: Roger Kisby for The New York Times

results.abstract: The director’s ambitious anthology series for Amazon and the BBC is his first film work about Black life in Britain. “I needed to understand myself, where I came from,” he said.
results.title: In ‘Small Axe,’ Steve McQueen Explores Britain’s Caribbean Heritage

results.title: Friends Forever, Filmmakers for Now
results.abstract: The stars and co-writers of “The Climb,” Michael Angelo Covino and Kyle Marvin, are best pals in real life. What was it like to make a bromance involving betrayal?

results.title: Sophia Loren Makes Her Return to Film: ‘I’m a Perfectionist’
results.abstract: The star, now 86, was looking for a personal connection to a script. Then along came her director son and the Netflix drama “The Life Ahead.”

results.title: Israel Horovitz, Playwright Tarnished by Abuse Allegations, Dies at 81
results.abstract: Mr. Horovitz found success Off Broadway, working with actors who later became household names, but he was also accused by multiple women of a pattern of sexual misconduct and assault.

results.title: They Are Also 2 Wild and Crazy Guys
des_facet: A Wealth of Pigeons: A Cartoon Collection (Book)
results.abstract: Steve Martin wanted to make cartoons, but he can only draw stick figures. He teamed up with the illustrator Harry Bliss, and the result is their new book, “A Wealth of Pigeons.”

results.abstract: Decades-old movies, songs and video games have surged in popularity over the pandemic. Psychologists say conjuring nostalgia during stressful times is a healthy coping mechanism.
results.title: Go Ahead, Binge Old Movies and Jam Out to ’90s Hits

results.title: Gigi Proietti, Actor Who Embodied the Roman Spirit, Dies at 80

results.title: Comfort Viewing: Why I Love Anything With Kathryn Hahn
results.abstract: Hahn’s ability to so effectively communicate her private thoughts to the viewer places her in company with some of the writer’s favorite actors.

results.title: Johnny Depp Leaves ‘Fantastic Beasts’ Franchise at Studio’s Request
des_facet: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (Movie)
results.abstract: The exit comes days after Mr. Depp lost a libel case against the publisher of a British newspaper that called him a “wife beater.”

multimedia.caption: “I have been asked to resign by Warner Bros. from my role as Grindelwald in Fantastic Beasts and I have respected and agreed to that request,” Johnny Depp wrote in an Instagram post on Friday.

results.title: ‘Shaft,’ ‘Dirty Harry’ and the Rise of the Supercop
results.abstract: In 1971, the lawman who does as he pleases strutted through movies like ‘The French Connection.’ But Black filmmakers found an alternative version.

results.title: Elsa Raven, ‘Back to the Future’ Character Actress, Dies at 91
results.abstract: She built a steady career of Everywoman roles. Perhaps none of them made a bigger impression than her performance as “Clocktower Lady.”

multimedia.caption: Elsa Raven as “Clocktower Lady” in “Back to the Future” (1985). “It’s an evergreen,” she said of that film. “It’s not today. It’s any day.”
